intro: Coussarea meridionalis var. porophylla, commonly known as the southern coussarea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
